eligibility.title: Wer darf w√§hlen? / Who Can Vote?
requirements: Registered at least 3 months before election / Mindestens 3 Monate vor der Wahl gemeldet
Not excluded from voting / Nicht vom Wahlrecht ausgeschlossen
eligibility.notes: EU citizens can vote in local and European Parliament elections. Only German citizens can vote in federal (Bundestag) elections.

registration.title: Wahlberechtigung / Voter Registration
steps: Registration is automatic when you register your address (Anmeldung) / Anmeldung beim Einwohnermeldeamt gen√ºgt
You will receive a Wahlbenachrichtigung (polling card) by mail / Sie erhalten automatisch eine Wahlbenachrichtigung
Check your Wahlbenachrichtigung for your polling station / Pr√ºfen Sie Ihre Wahlbenachrichtigung f√ºr Ihr Wahllokal
If you don't receive it, contact your local election office / Bei Nichterhalt: Wahlamt kontaktieren
registration.deadlines: Automatic registration through address registration. Absentee ballot requests must be submitted by the Friday before election (usually 18:00).
registration.notes: Germany has automatic voter registration. You don't need to actively register if you're registered at your address (Anmeldung).

votingMethods.title: Wie kann ich w√§hlen? / How to Vote

methods.description: Vote at your assigned polling station on election day (Sunday)
methods.requirements: Bring your Wahlbenachrichtigung and ID card (Personalausweis)

methods.description: Vote by mail using a Briefwahlunterlagen (postal voting documents)
methods.requirements: Request by Friday before election at 18:00. Can request online, by mail, or in person.

methods.type: Voting from Abroad / W√§hlen im Ausland
methods.description: German citizens living abroad can vote if registered in electoral roll
methods.requirements: Must apply for inclusion in electoral register (W√§hlerverzeichnis)

pollingLocations.title: Wo kann ich w√§hlen? / Where to Vote
howToFind: Check your Wahlbenachrichtigung for your assigned polling station / Wahlbenachrichtigung pr√ºfen
Contact your local Rathaus (town hall) / Kontakt zum √∂rtlichen Rathaus
Call your local Wahlamt (election office) / Wahlamt anrufen
Polling stations are usually in schools, community centers, or public buildings / Meist in Schulen oder √∂ffentlichen Geb√§uden
pollingLocations.notes: Your polling station (Wahllokal) is printed on your Wahlbenachrichtigung. Elections are always on Sundays, typically 8:00-18:00.

requiredDocuments.title: Ben√∂tigte Dokumente / Required Documents
requiredDocuments.description: You need your Wahlbenachrichtigung and an ID document
acceptedIds: Personalausweis (German ID card) - REQUIRED if no Wahlbenachrichtigung
If you lost your Wahlbenachrichtigung, bring ID and they'll look you up
requiredDocuments.notes: The Wahlbenachrichtigung is not legally required but makes voting much faster. Always bring some form of ID.

importantDates.title: Wichtige Termine / Important Dates
importantDates.description: Federal elections (Bundestagswahl) are held every 4 years on Sundays
importantDates.presidentialElection: Bundespr√§sident is elected every 5 years by Federal Convention (not direct vote)
importantDates.generalElection: Bundestagswahl (Federal Parliament) every 4 years, typically in September or October
importantDates.notes: Elections are always on Sundays. European Parliament elections every 5 years. State elections (Landtagswahlen) vary by state.

accessibility.title: Barrierefreiheit / Voting Accessibility
services: Wheelchair-accessible polling stations (Rollstuhlgerecht)
Assistance available at polling stations (Wahlhelfer)
Braille ballot templates for visually impaired voters (Stimmzettelschablonen)
Vote-by-mail option for those unable to visit polling stations (Briefwahl)
Sign language interpreters can be requested (Geb√§rdensprachdolmetscher)

resources.name: Bundeswahlleiter (Federal Returning Officer)
resources.description: Official federal election information in English and German

resources.name: Wahl-O-Mat
resources.description: Interactive tool to compare your views with parties (German only)

GERMANY.stateSpecificNote: State elections (Landtagswahlen) and local elections (Kommunalwahlen) are administered by state electoral authorities. Rules may vary slightly by state (Bundesland).

eligibility.title: Qui peut voter ? / Who Can Vote?
requirements: 18 years or older / 18 ans ou plus
Registered on electoral roll / Inscrit sur les listes √©lectorales
Full civil and political rights / Jouir de ses droits civils et politiques
eligibility.notes: EU citizens can vote in European and municipal elections. Only French citizens vote in presidential and legislative elections.

registration.title: Inscription √©lectorale / Voter Registration
steps: Register online at service-public.fr or in person at your mairie (town hall) / Inscription en ligne ou √† la mairie
Provide proof of identity and residence / Fournir justificatif d'identit√© et de domicile
Registration deadline: 6 weeks before election / Limite d'inscription : 6 semaines avant
Receive electoral card (carte √©lectorale) by mail / Recevoir la carte d'√©lecteur par courrier
registration.deadlines: Must register at least 6 weeks before an election. Online registration possible year-round.
registration.notes: Registration is not automatic. You must actively register at your mairie or online via service-public.fr.

methods.description: Vote at your assigned bureau de vote on election day (Sunday)
methods.requirements: Bring carte d'√©lecteur and ID (carte d'identit√© or passport)

methods.description: Authorize someone to vote on your behalf if you cannot vote in person
methods.requirements: Must be done in advance at police station, gendarmerie, or consulate

methods.description: French citizens abroad can vote at consulates or embassy
methods.requirements: Must register on consular electoral roll

pollingLocations.title: O√π voter ? / Where to Vote
howToFind: Check your carte d'√©lecteur for your bureau de vote / V√©rifier la carte d'√©lecteur
Visit your local mairie (town hall) / Visiter la mairie
Check online at service-public.fr / V√©rifier en ligne
Call your mairie / Appeler la mairie
pollingLocations.notes: Your bureau de vote (polling station) is assigned based on your address. Elections are on Sundays, usually 8:00-20:00 (may close earlier in small towns).

requiredDocuments.title: Documents requis / Required Documents
requiredDocuments.description: You need your electoral card and an official ID
acceptedIds: Carte d'identit√© nationale (national ID card) - REQUIRED
Carte vitale with photo - Sometimes accepted
If you lost your carte d'√©lecteur, bring ID and they'll verify your registration
requiredDocuments.notes: The carte d'√©lecteur speeds up the process but official photo ID is always required.

importantDates.title: Dates importantes / Important Dates
importantDates.description: Presidential elections every 5 years, legislative elections every 5 years
importantDates.presidentialElection: √âlection pr√©sidentielle every 5 years (2022, 2027, 2032, etc.) - Two rounds
importantDates.generalElection: √âlections l√©gislatives (National Assembly) every 5 years, shortly after presidential
importantDates.notes: Presidential elections have two rounds (2 weeks apart) if no candidate gets 50%+. Legislative elections also use two-round system. All elections on Sundays.

accessibility.title: Accessibilit√© / Voting Accessibility
services: Wheelchair-accessible polling stations (Bureaux de vote accessibles)
Assistance available (right to be accompanied / droit d'√™tre accompagn√©)
Braille information and templates (Information et gabarits en braille)
Proxy voting for those unable to travel (Vote par procuration)
Priority access for persons with disabilities (Acc√®s prioritaire)

resources.name: Check Your Registration / V√©rifier votre inscription
French Citizens Abroad
resources.description: Voting information for French citizens living abroad

FRANCE.stateSpecificNote: France is divided into d√©partements, but electoral administration is centralized. Municipal elections (√©lections municipales) are local but follow national rules.

eligibility.title: Who Can Vote?
requirements: 18 years or older on election day
eligibility.notes: You don't need to be registered in advance - you can register at the polls on election day with proper ID.

registration.title: How to Register to Vote
steps: Update your information when you file taxes (automatic)
Register in person when getting or renewing your driver's license
Register at the polls on election day (same-day registration)
registration.deadlines: No deadline! You can register to vote up to and including election day.
registration.notes: Canada has same-day voter registration. You can register when you vote on election day.

methods.description: Vote early at advance polling stations (Friday-Monday, 9 days before election)
methods.requirements: Bring proof of identity and address

methods.description: Vote at your assigned polling station on election day (Monday)
methods.requirements: Bring proof of identity and address

methods.description: Request a mail-in ballot from Elections Canada
methods.requirements: Apply online or in person at an Elections Canada office

methods.description: Canadian citizens living abroad can vote by mail

pollingLocations.title: Where to Vote
howToFind: Use the Elections Canada Voter Information Service: 1-800-463-6868
Check your Voter Information Card for your polling station
Visit elections.ca to find your polling place
pollingLocations.notes: Your polling station is listed on your Voter Information Card mailed to you before the election. Federal elections are always on Mondays.

requiredDocuments.title: Required ID Documents
requiredDocuments.description: You need to prove your identity and address to vote
acceptedIds: Option 1: One piece of ID with photo, name, and address (driver's license)
Option 2: Two pieces of ID with your name (health card + utility bill)
Option 3: Take an oath and have someone vouch for you (both must be from same polling division)
Accepted: Driver's license, health card, Canadian passport, birth certificate, utility bills, bank statements, government letters
requiredDocuments.notes: Elections Canada accepts 45+ types of ID. If you don't have ID, you can still vote by taking an oath and having another registered voter vouch for you.

importantDates.title: Important Election Dates
importantDates.description: Federal elections must be held at least every 4 years (fixed election date law)
importantDates.presidentialElection: Canada has a Prime Minister (not President). The PM is the leader of the party with the most seats.
importantDates.generalElection: Federal elections are held every 4 years on the 3rd Monday in October (or earlier if government falls)
importantDates.notes: Provincial elections are managed by provinces. Municipal elections vary by municipality.

accessibility.title: Voting Accessibility
services: All polling stations are wheelchair accessible or have alternatives nearby
Magnifying sheets and large print ballots available
Braille alphabet cards and tactile ballot templates
Sign language interpreters available upon request
You can bring someone to help you vote
Curbside voting if you can't enter the polling station
Vote by mail if you cannot visit a polling station

resources.name: Voter Information Service
resources.description: Find your polling station and electoral district

resources.name: Online Voter Registration
resources.description: Register or update your voter information

resources.name: Election Results
resources.description: View past and current election results

resources.name: Provincial Electoral Agencies
resources.description: Links to provincial and territorial election agencies

CANADA.stateSpecificNote: Provincial and territorial elections are managed by separate provincial electoral agencies. Municipal elections vary by province and municipality.

eligibility.title: Who Can Vote?
requirements: British, Irish or qualifying Commonwealth citizen
18 years or older (or 16+ in Scotland and Wales for some elections)
Resident at an address in the UK (or British citizen living abroad for less than 15 years)
eligibility.notes: EU citizens can vote in local elections in England, Scotland and Wales, and all elections in Northern Ireland.

registration.title: How to Register to Vote
steps: Deadline is usually 12 working days before an election
registration.deadlines: Register by 12 working days before an election. Register for a postal vote by 11 working days before. Register for a proxy vote by 6 working days before.
registration.notes: You need to register separately for each type of election if you move. Registration is online and takes about 5 minutes.

methods.description: Vote at your local polling station on election day (Thursday)
methods.requirements: From May 2023: Photo ID required in England, Wales, Northern Ireland (not Scotland yet)

methods.description: Receive ballot papers by post and return them by election day
methods.requirements: Apply by 11 working days before election

methods.description: Appoint someone to vote on your behalf
methods.requirements: Apply by 6 working days before election (emergency proxy until 5pm on election day)

methods.description: British citizens abroad can vote for up to 15 years after leaving UK

pollingLocations.title: Where to Vote
howToFind: Check your poll card (sent before election) for your polling station
Use the gov.uk polling station finder
Contact your local Electoral Registration Office
pollingLocations.notes: Polling stations are usually in schools, community centers, or local halls. They're open 7am-10pm on election day (Thursday).

requiredDocuments.title: Required ID Documents
requiredDocuments.description: From May 2023: Photo ID required to vote in England, Wales, and Northern Ireland (not Scotland)
acceptedIds: Voter Authority Certificate (free from local council)
requiredDocuments.notes: If you don't have photo ID, you can apply for a free Voter Authority Certificate from your local council.

importantDates.title: Important Election Dates
importantDates.description: General elections must be held every 5 years maximum
importantDates.presidentialElection: UK has a Prime Minister (not President). The PM is leader of the party with most MPs.
importantDates.generalElection: General elections for House of Commons every 5 years (or earlier if Parliament is dissolved)
importantDates.notes: Elections are always on Thursdays. Local elections vary by area. Scottish Parliament, Welsh Senedd, and Northern Ireland Assembly have separate elections.

accessibility.title: Voting Accessibility
services: All polling stations must be accessible or provide assistance
Tactile voting device for blind and partially sighted voters
Large print ballot papers available
Assistance from polling staff or companion
Postal vote available if you can't get to polling station
Proxy vote if someone else needs to vote for you

UK.stateSpecificNote: Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland have devolved governments with separate elections. Local elections are managed by local authorities. Rules may differ between England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland.
